intro: Lithocardium tremulum, commonly known as the trembling rock-cress, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and white or pale yellow. Lithocardium tremulum is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
